scope

Class CharacterScope

  • java.lang.Object
    • scope.AlphabetScope<java.lang.Character>
      • scope.CharacterScope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scope<java.lang.Character>

    public class CharacterScope
extends AlphabetScope<java.lang.Character>
    An implementation of an AlphabetScope for characters.
    Version:
    October 2019
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Constructor Detail

      • CharacterScope

        public CharacterScope()
        If no scope is specified, use the default alphabet.

      • CharacterScope

        public CharacterScope(java.lang.String alphabet)
        Specify the scope by means of a String.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - the alphabet to be used for this scope.

      • CharacterScope

        public CharacterScope(java.util.Set<java.lang.Character> alphabet)
        Specify the scope by means of a set of values.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - the set of permitted values for this scope.

    • Method Detail

      • toCharacterSet

        private static java.util.Set<java.lang.Character> toCharacterSet(java.lang.String source)
        Utility to convert a String specification of an alphabet to a set of characters. Note that since the target is a set, and duplicates will automatically be removed.
        Parameters:
        source - the String specification of the desired alphabet.
        Returns:
        a set of all the characters in the source string.
